facts: Puppies have 28 teeth and normal adult dogs have 42
Dogs' eyes contain a special membrane called the tapetum lucidum, which allows them to see better in the dark.
A large dog's resting heart rate is between 60 and 100 beats per minute, and a small dog's heart beats between 100 and 140 beats per minute.
A dog's normal body temperature is between 101 and 102.5 degrees Fahrenheit.
Dogs sweat through the pads of their feet.
A dog's sense of smell is 10,000 to 100,000 times more acute than that of humans.
In addition to sweating through their paw pads, dogs pant to cool themselves down.  A panting dog can take 300-400 breaths per minute with very little effort.
If never spayed or neutered, a female dog, her mate, and their puppies could produce over 66,000 dogs in 6 years!
Obesity is the #1 health problem among dogs.
Dogs' nose prints are as unique as a human's finger prints, and can be used to accurately identify them.
The first living being in space was Laika the dog in 1957.
Chocolate contains a substance called theobromine (similar to caffeine) which can kill dogs or at the least make them violently ill.
Smaller dog breeds mature faster than large ones.
Puppies sleep 90% of the day for their first few weeks.
A dog's sense of hearing is more than 10 times more acute than a human's.
Dogs with little human contact in the first three months typically don't make good pets.
You can lower your blood pressure by petting your dog.
If a guy has a dog with him, he's three times more likely to get a girl's phone number.
The average dog is as intelligent as a two-year-old child.
Most dogs don't really like to be hugged.
One of Michael Vick's former fighting dogs, Leo, went on to be a therapy dog who comforted dying children.
Dogs are omnivorous; they need to eat more than just meat.
Spaying or neutering your dog can prevent certain types of cancer.
Dogs are among a small group of animals who show voluntary unselfish kindness towards others without any reward.
Most dog obedience training issues and bad dog behaviors are a result of human error or misunderstanding.
